answers.answer: Trinadoo,Is the pain in your intestines or your stomach?  Lots of diabetics have diabetic gastroparesis.  Do you also have bloating, reflux, nausea or vomiting in addition to the abdominal pain?  I am not diabetic but have this and had significant pain and bloating from it.  Some people also have nausea and vomiting.  It is due to damage to the vagus nerve that runs through the stomach.  The disease it is most associated with is diabetes-which you say you have--especially diabetes of long duration.  I would do a search on it if I were you and see if you think it fits.  Just type in "diabetic gastroparesis" and you will come up with a lot of information.  The best way to diagnose it, though, is with a gastric emptying scan-it will show if it exists and how severe it is.  Ask your doctor about it.  If you see an endocrinologist for the diabetes I would think they would know about it, but PCPs/internists don't seem to know as much about it--mine didn't.  There are drugs that help to move the food through and lessen the pain and bloating and nausea--Reglan, domperidone, erythromycin, Zelnorm, etc.  Good luck.
